newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares edge higher, RBNZ takes shine off rally.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares edge higher, RBNZ takes shine off rally.

text.p: * New Zealand close firmer but off highs
* Reserve Bank takes shine off rally
New Zealand share prices edged higher after hitting a fresh 32-month peak, but brokers said the Reserve Bank's warning shot helped take the shine off the rally.

The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 4.32 points higher at 2,325.98 but was off its peak of 2,333.75 after the Reserve Bank said there was no scope for an easing after Tuesday's better-than-expected inflation data.
"The brakes were put on the equities market by the statement that there would be no room for further easing," Tim Koller at Hendry Hay McIntosh said.
But the fact that Telecom, after its record-breaking run, gave up only one cent to NZ$7.31 said much about the market and its inherent support.
The Small Companies Index was again very strong, firming 50.95 points to 4,631.97, bringing its rise to 3.5 percent over the past two days.
Koller said that reflected an appetite for value stocks.
Outside the top five, Independent Newspapers firmed 30 points to NZ$6.50 and Waste Management gained 25 to $5.75.
There also some large crossings, among them 5.4 million GPG shares selling at NZ$0.78, and 1.27 million Air New Zealand B shares at NZ$3.70.
"Overall the market is very well underpinned and the Small Companies Index being up another percent today just shows the strength of the broader market," Koller said.
